page.title: 09THE GIANT OF SESSAY .2.
page.content: Sir Guy was a typical knight in shining armour, but had some misgivings about taking the brute on. As Sir Guy and Joan were having dinner one evening, the brute appeared making for the windmill to steal a sack of grain. Sir Guy dashed out to give battle. Just as the Giant was reaching for the sack he was hit on the head by one of the sails of the windmill. Sir Guy dispatched the Giant.... married Joan and became the owner of thousands of acres of land in the area of Sessay, perhaps providing his descendants with the necessary funds to build a stately home at Cowick.
